This is an old story, the "Drop" in human sperm court probably a product of how to count sperm. The base human sperm count was in 1973 and was concentrated in urban cities We know that males will produce more sperm if they live with a high concentration of other males. Subsequet sperm count went to rural third world areas, to get an better overall overview of spearm count. Males in such environments have lower sperm count.
This difference in sperm count has been known for a long time. It is believed a result of proto humans binding together as tribes with the males competing not by fighting but shooting their sperm one after another into a female. The male with the most spearm had the best chance of impregnating a female. This competition ended when proto humans evolved into a creature that entered pair bond relationship between one male and one female. Once pair bond became the human norm, sperm competition ended and with it the drive for bigger testicles (Chimpanzees continued on that path and Chimos testicles are twice as large as human have).
Thus by switching the pool of males to include males in rural areas would always drop the male sperm counts in humans. Thus the latter sperm count effort was design to give a better overall overview of human sperm count. It is not something new.

Populations tend to reduce offspring when their numbers get too big. I mean there are 8 billion people in the world. Deer and wolf population follow a pattern of population rise and fall, too. Deer overpopulate, wolves increase their numbers. Deer population drops, and wolves decrease their numbers. It's a kind of feast and famine cycle. Yet it keeps deer in check from over-grazing the foliage as well: it prevents deer from eating every plant in an area so that it is impossible for anything to grow.

Humans don't have any natural predators, though there are many animals who, hand to paw or wing, can win outright in a fight. (I.e. no guns.)

Researchers back in the 1980's at the time seemed to me to have started deer population is not dependent on wolf predation activity rising and falling. And there are other factors in their makeup as well.

One is called Sex Ratio, the ratio of male to female animals. If a species has a Sex Ratio of greater than one, (more males than females) it indicates a prosperous population and a tendency to grow in general. If the Sex Ratio is less than one (more females), more females are born as the population is poor and not thriving. Thus it is necessary to bear more young. Could we be reacting to the high population in this world?
